arguments.argument: Nuclear energy produces minimal greenhouse gas emissions.
It provides reliable base-load power compared to renewables.
Modern reactors are much safer and more efficient.
It can help bridge the gap as we scale up renewable energy.
Nuclear energy supports energy independence.
It uses far less land than solar or wind farms.
Advanced reactors reduce the risk of meltdown and waste.
It creates high-paying jobs in science and engineering.
Investments in nuclear can drive innovation.
It can stabilize the energy grid during high demand periods.
Nuclear accidents can cause catastrophic damage.
Radioactive waste remains hazardous for thousands of years.
Building nuclear plants is extremely expensive and slow.
Decommissioning plants is complex and costly.
Uranium mining harms ecosystems and Indigenous lands.
Nuclear proliferation risks increase with expanded use.
Public opposition makes siting new plants politically difficult.
Safer and cheaper renewables are already available.
It diverts resources from faster-deployable energy solutions.
Security threats at nuclear facilities pose national risks.
